caption.body: Famed industrial designer Raymond Loewy (1893–1986) designed and styled everything from Studebaker cars to refrigerators, corporate logos, and the NASA Skylab. Loewy oversaw the first redesign of the iconic Coca-Cola bottle in 1954, in a “slenderized” version with bright, white lettering to stand out in vending machines.  All objects are from the collection of Steve Cabella. See more #midcentury #modern #design in "#AModernApproach: Mid-Century Design", on display, pre-security, in the International Terminal. http://bit.ly/AModernApproach
caption.excerpt: Famed industrial designer Raymond Loewy (1893–1986) designed and styled everything from Studebaker cars to refrigerators, corporate logos, and the NASA Skylab.
